channel.title: A floating city?
channel.description: How does it sound? Im totally up for it if we decide to make one.

item.title: A floating city?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“asyo4, post:45, topic:381118”]I’m surprised people are still commenting on this lol

Anyway, to get to it, I’m not too sure yet. I tried making one on Toms server, I just had a huge ladder going up to it. I thought of this idea to avoid greifers and just a whole new unique city.[/quote]
On tom’s server, use a launcher pad.

Read full topic

item.title: A floating city?
item.dc:creator: @asyo4 asyo4
item.description:
@asyo4 wrote:

I’m surprised people are still commenting on this lol

Anyway, to get to it, I’m not too sure yet. I tried making one on Toms server, I just had a huge ladder going up to it. I thought of this idea to avoid greifers and just a whole new unique city.

Read full topic

item.title: A floating city?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“k0 twin, post:43, topic:381118”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=476934.msg3492127#msg3492127 date=1297015449]

It doesn’t have to be that difficult. First of all, what FC said is definitely a great way for vertical travel. You go crazy fast. Second of all, just use /home to get TO your house, and put a small lake under your floating house, so you can just jump down into it, as suggested by others.

Boat elevators work fine but you would be wasting a boat to travel upwards when you could just teleport.

Then someone closes the pit off and waits for someone to jump, amirite

That’s easy enough to fix, just place a block of water up top and climb down.

No matter what you go with there’s always something someone can do to kill you/break your system.

what about when someone places a city under and then rages at you for griefing
[/quote]
The what if game doesn’t end. Like I said, nothing you go with will be perfect.[/quote]
Yeah I was just proving the point

Read full topic

item.title: A floating city?
item.dc:creator: @xxxxxx_13 xxxxxx 13
item.description:
@xxxxxx_13 wrote:

Probably a bad idea but…have a landing area. Put a boat over a tnt block. Have a explosion delay. using red powder. player steps onto the switch triggers the timer. jumps into the boat…waits. BOOOM tnt explodes under the boat. boat goes ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ wayyyy up in the air. player moves forward/side/backwards a few blocks space while in midair so they dont fall back down the entrance hole. Land…hopefully they survive? maybe make the landing area surrounding the entrance to the hole in the bottom of the city water or something they can land on hard and not get hurt.

Again terrible idea but it would be awesome. not sure how much tnt. But the basic idea for this comes from player cannons that have been built using tnt.

Read full topic

item.title: A floating city?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:28, topic:381118”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=476934.msg3490017#msg3490017 date=1296875484]

Someone could easily remove the water pad, and would camp and wait for someone to die, and “loot it and boot it”, so to speak.

Yea, your city will never be “high enough” to be unseen.

Although if you dig a large enough area out in the ground, it could be deep enough. Lmfao
[/quote]

Pretty much you need a lake.[/quote]
I was thinking more along the lines of tunneling deep into the ground, making it look like just another cave. If you go deep enough, you find ‘Atlantis’. Actually, I might do this lmfao.

Read full topic

item.title: A floating city?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:23, topic:381118”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=476934.msg3489951#msg3489951 date=1296871681]

I think as long as you hide it far away, it’s an ok idea and completely plausable. Just have a long as waterfall to get down, and use /home to get to the top again.

Water pad at the bottom = less conspicuous.

Missing the pad at the bottom = priceless. As in now your shit is gone.
[/quote]

Which is why you build it so that you never miss?[/quote]

I haven’t taken physics yet.

Read full topic
